subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: Some Warlocks make pacts with ancient gods, others with fiendish devils, or even just a plain old talking sword. But not you, no uou choose to make a pact with the crackling energy that forms the {@spell Eldritch Blast} spell itself. Is it a god, some primordial power, or just an idea? Who knows? Regardless of your reason for such a bizzare pact, you've gained an unparalleled mastery and understanding of the {@spell Eldritch Blast} spell.

entries.subclassFeature: Pact Boon Option: Pact of the Blast|Warlock||Eldritch Blast|EBPatron|1|EBPatron

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Blaster
entries: Starting at 1st level, your prowess with {@spell Eldritch Blast} spell is greatly enhanced. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you cast {@spell Eldritch Blast} as your action you can cast it again as your bonus action.
When you cast {@spell Eldritch Blast}, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If that spell hits, you add +10 to the spell's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Boon Option: Pact of the Blast
entries: {@footnote When you select a pact boon at 3rd level, you may instead select the following option:|This feature was added because homebrew cannot modify existing site data, which the Pact Boon feature counts as.}

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Deflection
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your reaction to cast {@spell Eldritch Blast} in an attempt to deflect a weapon when you are hit by a melee attack. When you do so, the damage yo utake from the attack is reduced by the damage from your {@spell Eldritch Blast}.
If you reduce the damage to 0, you disarm the target, forcing it to drop the weapon used in the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Bombardment
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can spend 1 spell slot to unleash a barrage of {@spell Eldritch Blast|PHB|Eldritch Blasts} at a point you can see within the range of your {@spell Eldritch Blast}. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 10d10} force damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one.
The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each Warlock level you have above 10.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Cloak
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can spend 2 spell slots to enhance your body with a cloak of crackling energy. You gain the following benefits for 1 minute.

items: When you use an action to cast {@spell Eldritch Blast} you can immediately cast it again as part of the same action.
Whenever you take damage you may roll a number of {@dice d10} equal to the number of beams created by your {@spell Eldritch Blast} and reduce the damage by the result.
Your movement speed is equal to the range of your {@spell Eldritch Blast}

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blast
entries: Once per turn when you cast the {@spell Eldritch Blast} spell you may choose one of the following options to modify the spell.

entries.name: Precision Shot
entries: You increase the damage dice of your {@spell Eldritch Blast} to a {@dice d12} but all beams created by the spell must target the same creature.

entries.name: Burst Shot
entries: You can reduce the damage dice of your {@spell Eldritch Blast} to a {@dice d6} to double the number of beams the spell creates.

entries.name: Elemental Shot
entries: You may change the type of damage done by your {@spell Eldritch Blast} to a type of your choosing.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Eldritch Blaster
entries: When you use your Pact of the Blast ability you may choose to use one of these options.

entries.name: Piercer Shot
entries: The beams created by your {@spell Eldritch Blast} form a line of 100 feet long and 5 feet wide that blasts out from you in a direction of your choosing. Each creature in the line with an AC lower than your spell attack roll takes that beam's damage.

entries.name: Cluster Shot
entries: The beams created by your {@spell Eldritch Blast} erupt into 20-foot-radius spheres at points of your choosing. Each creature in the sphere's radius with an AC lower than your spell attack roll takes that beam's damage.
